properties.name: Copacabana, Bolivia
properties.description: Posted by JhindmanWhile I traveled throughout Peru I was on a 90 day visa, which would definately not voer my entire stay. I traveled to this town on Lake Titicaca as a day trip in order to renew my Peruvian visa... I subsequently was incarerated by corrupt border guards because... long story

properties.name: Cuzco
properties.description: Posted by JhindmanI lived in Peru for approximately 4.5 months in the winter of 2006-2007. On the weekends all the volunteers would travel into this city for the night life. The discotecs were amazing, dancing till 7 in the morning!

properties.name: Galveston
properties.description: Posted by JhindmanWhen I was 7 years old I flew for the first time on my own to Houston Texas to visit my aunt. As a day trip she took me to Galveston island where we visited the fish market and bought fresh crab and crawfish for dinner!

properties.name: Lima
properties.description: Posted by JhindmanWhen I did my travels to Peru I had to travel through the capital of Lima. Other than the ocean being gorgeous and the surf being amazing, it was by all means a dirty city with not much to offer.

properties.name: Pisac
properties.description: Posted by JhindmanI lived in Peru for approximately 4.5 months in the winter of 2006-2007. My host family for 3 of those months lived in the small town of Pisac in the Urubamba River Valley.

properties.name: Puerto Maldonado
properties.description: Posted by JhindmanFor the last month of my stay in Peru, I spent it in the Rain Forest on the border of Brazil. The town of Puerto Maldonado was the closest thing to civilization that we had on the weekends when we left our jungle lodge.

properties.name: San Jose
properties.description: Posted by JhindmanSan Jose, Costa ricaIn the summer of my Sophmore year in High School my family traveled to Costa Rica. We stayed in San Jose for 4 days I believe.

properties.name: Sanibel Island
properties.description: Posted by Jhindman, , FLI believe it was during my freshman year in High School that my family took this trip. We came down to Florida and visited Sanibel Island, an island reknowned for being the number one island for Seashell collectors. Let me put it this way, they had a 3D map of the town made entirely of seashells...

properties.name: Times Square
properties.description: Posted by Jhindman1588 Broadway, New York, NYNearly every year in High School I participated in the Model United Nations program. During my junior and senior years we traveled to the National MUN convention in New York City. We visited the UN building as well as experienced most aspects of New York.

properties.name: Tortuguero
properties.description: Posted by JhindmanWhen my family traveled to Costa Rica we took about 2 nights and spent it in the only town within this east coast national reserve. The town was a tourist destination for those wishing to watch sea turtle nesting.
